turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I'm calling about a claim I filed last week. The claim number is 20231027-4815.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you for calling. Please wait one moment while I access claim 20231027-4815. Okay, I have it here. This is for water damage to your kitchen, is that correct?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Yes, that's right. I sent in all the photos and the plumber's report. What's the status? It's been over a week, and I haven't heard anything. I'm getting pretty frustrated, to be honest. I can't use my kitchen!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. I see here that we received the documentation. The claim is currently under review by our claims adjuster. It typically takes 7-10 business days for the initial review. We should have an update for you within the next two business days.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, two business days... What exactly are they reviewing? I mean, the pipe burst, it caused damage, I filed the claim with all the evidence. What else is there to review? Also, what if the adjuster denies my claim? What recourse do I have?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: The adjuster is reviewing the extent of the damage, validating the cause against your policy coverage, and confirming the estimated repair costs. In the event of a denial, you have the right to appeal the decision. The details of the appeals process will be included in the denial letter. Would you like me to send you a link to the general claims appeal process now?
